page.title: 03Cameley Vale Industry i
page.content: This page discusses the industrial archaeology of the area. The Victoria History of Somerset mentions large and productive woodlands in the parish in 1794.Small scale tree felling continued into the mid-20th cent. In the Greyfield area in the n.e. are the remains of 18th and 19th cent. coal workings. Quarrying has a long history,and it has been suggested that 'Temple Cloud' means 'the quarry of the Knights Templar'.The last working quarry closed in 1939.The stone is Blue Pennant,known locally as Temple Stone. At the beginning of the century clay was mined (the workings extend under the school),and used to make bricks and tiles.A sawmill was later built on the site of the brickworks to exploit Paulwood.It closed about 20 years ago.
